com.percussion.services.guidmgr
Interface IPSGuidManager

public interface IPSGuidManager

Create globally unique ids for use when creating service objects. The methods that begin with 'create' are generally only useful to the system. Implementers will be interested in the methods that begin with 'make'. There are also methods for converting between old-style item locators and guids. These are provided for interoperability between the old and new models.

Author:
dougrand

createGuid

IPSGuid createGuid(PSTypeEnum type)
Create a single new guid for the given type

Parameters:
type - the type, never null
Returns:
a new guid

createGuids

List<IPSGuid> createGuids(PSTypeEnum type,
                          int count)
Create a series of guids for the given type

Parameters:
type - the type, never null
count - the number of guids to create, must be a positive number
Returns:
a list of guids, the size of the list will equal count

createGuid

IPSGuid createGuid(byte repositoryId,
                   PSTypeEnum type)
Create a single new guid for the given type and repository

Parameters:
repositoryId - the repository id, must be greater than zero. Zero is the same as not using a repository. Negative is invalid.
type - the type, never null
Returns:
a new guid

createGuids

List<IPSGuid> createGuids(byte repositoryId,
                          PSTypeEnum type,
                          int count)
Create a series of guids for the given type and repository

repositoryId - the repository id, must be greater than zero. Zero is the same as not using a repository. Negative is invalid.
type - the type, never null
count - the number of guids to create, must be a positive number
Returns:
a list of guids, the size of the list will equal count

createId

int createId(String key)
Create a single id using values stored in the next number table.

Parameters:
key - the key, never null or empty
Returns:
the next allocated id

createLongId

long createLongId(PSTypeEnum type)
Allocate the next id for a given type and return only the 64 bit id. Most guids are only using the lower 32 bits, which is not always adequate for longer lived data for non design objects.

Parameters:
type - the type, provides the index into the saved next numbers for guids, never null.
Returns:
the next long id.

createIdBlock

int[] createIdBlock(String key,
                    int blocksize)
Allocate a block of ids from the values stored in the next number table.

Parameters:
key - the key, never null or empty
blocksize - the block size to allocate, must be a positive integer
Returns:
an array of allocated ids

getHostId

long getHostId()
Get the persisted host identifier. The host id is calculated internally and is a cryptographic random number, which makes it unlikely that any two host ids will conflict. The actual size of the random number is 2^24.

The host id is used to make two references from different machines not collide. The special host id value of 0 indicates that the guid is not a true guid and will likely collide across servers

Returns:
a valid host id

makeGuid

IPSGuid makeGuid(long raw,
                 PSTypeEnum type)
Recreates a guid instance from a value originally obtained from IPSGuid.longValue() or from a uuid.

Parameters:
raw - This value may or may not contain the type id. If it does, then it must match the supplied type, otherwise, the supplied type is used as the type for the new guid.
type - the type, never null
Returns:
a guid of the specified type built from the specified raw value, never null.

makeGuid

IPSGuid makeGuid(String raw,
                 PSTypeEnum type)
Recreates a guid instance from a human readable form of the guid.

Parameters:
raw - Never null or empty. The generic format of the supplied string is of the form: hostid-typeid-uuid (e.g. 10-103-125). A single long value that is supported by makeGuid(long, PSTypeEnum) can also be supplied, in which case, the rules defined in that method must be followed. Two different represenations are allowed: hostid-uuid, hostid-typeid-uuid. If a typeid is supplied, it must match that of the type param, otherwise, the supplied type is used. If the type is PSTypeEnum.LEGACY_CONTENT or PSTypeEnum.LEGACY_CHILD, the human readable forms are not supported.
type - the type, never null
Returns:
a guid of the specified type built from the specified raw value, never null.

makeGuid

IPSGuid makeGuid(PSLocator loc)
Create a legacy guid from a locator

Parameters:
loc - the locator for a content item, never null
Returns:
a guid of the PSTypeEnum.LEGACY_CONTENT type, never null.
See Also:
makeLocator(IPSGuid)

makeLocator

PSLocator makeLocator(IPSGuid guid)
Converts a legacy guid back into the locator format. This method is provided for interoperability between the old and new id models.

Parameters:
guid - Never null. Must have a type of PSTypeEnum.LEGACY_CONTENT.
Returns:
The locator for the item. The revision may or may not be set depending on whether it was present in the supplied guid.
See Also:
makeGuid(PSLocator)

extractContentIds

List<Integer> extractContentIds(List<IPSGuid> guids)
Extracts the content ids from a set of legacy guids. Non-content guids passed will cause an exception to be thrown.

Parameters:
guids - a list of guids, never null or empty, and must contain only content guids
Returns:
a list of content ids, equal in length to the input list and in the same order.
